info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL CIBOLA, NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO AND NORTHEASTERN CATRON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Datil, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cibola, northwestern Socorro and northeastern Catron Counties. This includes Highway 60 near Mile Marker 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
